movies.title: The Wars of the Roses
movies.plot: The entire cycle of Shakespeare's history plays performed by the English Shakespeare Company
movies.simplePlot: The entire cycle of Shakespeare's history plays performed by the English Shakespeare Company

biography.bio: Ben Bazell is an actor, known for Witness Against Hitler (1996), Genghis Cohn (1993) and Switch-Off (1977).
biography.name: Ben Bazell

biography.bio: Roger Booth was born in 1933 in East Stonehouse, Devon, England as Roger Thomas Booth. He was an actor, known for Barry Lyndon (1975), Cutthroat Island (1995) and Ladies in Lavender (2004). He died on February 26, 2014 in London, England.
biography.name: Roger Booth

biography.bio: Philip Bowen was born in 1949 in Liverpool, Merseyside, England. He is an actor, known for Taking sides - Le cas Furtwängler (2001), The Government Inspector (2005) and The Discovery of Heaven (2001).
biography.name: Philip Bowen

biography.bio: Paul Brennen is an actor, known for Alien 3 (1992), Incognito (1997) and The Lady (2011).
biography.name: Paul Brennen

biography.bio: Ian Burford was born in 1933 in Edinburgh, Scotland. He is an actor, known for Mr. Nice (2010), Silver (1999) and The Trial of Tony Blair (2007).
biography.name: Ian Burford

biography.bio: Michael Cronin is now forging a career as a children's author, his first novel was entitled "Against the Day" (1998) and subsequently has written two further books including "Through the Night" a sequel to his 1998 work. A noted performer on the stage he is probably best remembered as the fiery P.E. teacher Geoff 'Bullet' Baxter (almost always in his fetching tracksuit) from the long-running BBC children's TV show Grange Hill (1978). He also appeared regularly on the TV screen throughout the 70s and 80s most notably in Fawlty Towers (1975), Bergerac: Entente Cordiale (1990) and Agatha Christie's Poirot: The Mysterious Affair at Styles (1990). Although originally from Bedfordshire, Cronin now lives in London with his wife and two sons.
biography.name: Michael Cronin

biography.bio: Charles Dale was born in Tenby, Pembrokeshire in 1963. His father ran a record shop in Tenby and both his parents were keen amateur actors. After leaving school in 1979, he became an assistant stage manager (through a Youth Opportunity Scheme) at the Torch Theatre in Milford Haven, where he stayed for a year. After occasional acting roles, he moved to London and trained at LAMDA. He broke into television, when he appeared in Morgan's Boy (1984) and also worked consistently for the English Shakespeare Company. His big break came, when he appeared as the Chef, in a television series The Lakes (1997). He appeared in a couple of West End shows and played Dennis in Coronation Street (1960) for eighteen months. He later appeared as Clive, in Paradise Heights (2002) for the BBC with Neil Morrissey and Ralf Little as well as its spin-off The Eustace Bros. (2003). Further roles emerged in ITV's Steel River Blues (2004) and a children's series Barking! (2004) in 2004. He is married and lives in Wales with their son. He is a private family man who does not court publicity.
biography.name: Charles Dale

biography.bio: John Darrell is an actor, known for Electric Shades of Grey (2001), White Mischief (1987) and Whoops Apocalypse (1988).
biography.name: John Darrell

biography.bio: John Dougall is an actor, known for Dunrulin (1990), Taggart (1983) and Waking the Dead (2000).
biography.name: John Dougall

biography.bio: Colin Farrell was born on December 6, 1938 in London, England. He is an actor and composer, known for Oh! What a Lovely War (1969), Gandhi (1982) and A Bridge Too Far (1977). He is married to Ann Penfold.
biography.name: Colin Farrell

biography.bio: Michael Fenner is an actor, known for London's Burning (1988), A Feast at Midnight (1994) and Lost in London (1985).
biography.name: Michael Fenner

biography.bio: Andrew Jarvis is an actor, known for H.M.S. Pinafore (2003), Emmerdale (1972) and Second Spring.
biography.name: Andrew Jarvis

biography.bio: Ann Penfold is an actress, known for Owen, M.D. (1971), Keeping Rosy (2014) and Family Life (1971). She is married to Colin Farrell.
biography.name: Ann Penfold

biography.bio: Michael Pennington was born on June 7, 1943 in Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England as Michael Vivian Fyfe Pennington. He is known for his work on Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983), The Iron Lady (2011) and Fragile (2005). He was previously married to Katharine Barker.
biography.name: Michael Pennington

biography.bio: Clyde Pollitt was born on April 17, 1924 in Merthyr Tydfil, Wales as Robert Clyde Pollitt. He was an actor, known for Lady Jane (1986), Who Killed Menna Lorraine? (1960) and Moll Flanders (1975). He died on November 10, 1989 in Kensington, London, England.
biography.name: Clyde Pollitt

biography.bio: Sion Probert is an actor, known for Grand Slam (1978), Thicker Than Water (1993) and Crossroads (1964).
biography.name: Sion Probert

biography.bio: Barry Stanton was born in 1940. He is an actor, known for Shanghai Knights (2003), The Madness of King George (1994) and A Kid in King Arthur's Court (1995).
biography.name: Barry Stanton

biography.bio: Hugh Sullivan is an actor, known for Marat/Sade (1967), A Midsummer Night's Dream (1968) and Tell Me Lies (1968).
biography.name: Hugh Sullivan

biography.bio: John Tramper is an actor, known for Cyrano de Bergerac (1985), Tartuffe, or The Impostor (1983) and The Wars of the Roses (1965).
biography.name: John Tramper

biography.bio: Jack Carr was born on November 21, 1944 in Norfolk, England. He is an actor, known for The Crying Game (1992), 10 Rillington Place (1971) and Emmerdale (1972).
biography.name: Jack Carr

biography.bio: Stephen Jameson is an actor, known for Le Saint - Logiciel mortel (1989), The Bill (1984) and The Wars of the Roses (1965).
biography.name: Stephen Jameson

biography.bio: June Watson is an actress, known for 102 Dalmatians (2000), Gin & Dry (2010) and Highlander: Endgame (2000).
biography.name: June Watson

biography.bio: Jennifer Konko is an actress, known for The Wars of the Roses (1965).
biography.name: Jennifer Konko

biography.bio: Francesca Ryan was born in London, England. She is an actress, known for Hollyoaks (1995), Medics (1990) and The World of Eddie Weary (1990).
biography.name: Francesca Ryan

biography.bio: Phil Rees is an actor, known for Forbidden History (2013), The Wars of the Roses (1965) and Dispatches (1987).
biography.name: Phil Rees

biography.bio: Simon Elliott is an actor, known for The Leading Man (1996) and The Wars of the Roses (1965).
biography.name: Simon Elliott
